data.text: @kerrysmith654 @james_e_b_ When I was a student rep at uni, I once cited the research about teenagers having different body clocks to argue that 9am lectures should be cancelled in response to a question about poor attendance.
@deeharvey @james_e_b_ Maybe they just don't like Liams lectures and they are returning to other lectures 🤔

@james_e_b_ Schopenhauer really missed a trick on the empty lecture theatre front.

There were better diseases around then too and less effective treatment.
@james_e_b_ Teacher who doesn’t want students to attend class. That’s an interesting plot twist.

@james_e_b_ V v weird. Every class I take or that I know of here at uni is filled to the brim and no one wants to go remote again. I am going to take it as speaking French giving a certain level of protection against alienation.

@james_e_b_ @IvanIvanovichC2 It's just so shortsighted. Apart from the social aspect of learning, this is an open goal for universities to record and replay lecture content.

https://t.co/qwAOtaUumG
